title: Unit 7 Checkpoint: Vectors & Complex Numbers in Polar Form
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of vector representation, operations, dot product, projections, applications (work/forces/navigation), and complex numbers in polar form including DeMoivre's Theorem and nth roots.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Component form, magnitude, direction angle, unit vectors, i/j notation
Addition, subtraction, scalar multiplication, linear combinations
Algebraic and geometric dot product, angle formula, orthogonality test
Scalar projection comp_u(v), vector projection proj_u(v), decomposition
Work W=F·d, force components on inclined plane, navigation/bearing
Polar form z=r·cis(θ), multiplication/division, DeMoivre's, nth roots

assessmentProblems.question: Find the component form, magnitude, and direction angle of the vector from A(-2, 5) to B(4, -3).
Let u = ⟨-3, 7⟩ and v = ⟨5, 2⟩. Find: (a) 2u - 3v, (b) ||2u - 3v||, (c) a unit vector in the direction of 2u - 3v.
Find the angle between u = ⟨4, 3⟩ and v = ⟨-3, 4⟩. Are they orthogonal?
assessmentProblems.answer: u·v = 4(-3)+3(4) = -12+12 = 0. Since u·v = 0, the vectors are orthogonal. θ = 90°.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the angle between a = ⟨1, 2, -1⟩ and b = ⟨3, -1, 2⟩. (Note: 3D vectors use the same dot product formula.)
Find the scalar projection and vector projection of v = ⟨8, 6⟩ onto u = ⟨3, -4⟩. Then find the perpendicular component.
assessmentProblems.answer: v·u = 8(3)+6(-4) = 24-24 = 0. comp_u(v) = (v·u)/||u|| = 0/5 = 0. proj_u(v) = (0/25)⟨3,-4⟩ = ⟨0,0⟩. Perpendicular component: v - proj = ⟨8,6⟩ - ⟨0,0⟩ = ⟨8,6⟩. (v is entirely perpendicular to u, which confirms u·v=0.)

assessmentProblems.question: A force of F = ⟨-3, 5⟩ moves an object from point P(1, 2) to Q(7, 4). Find the work done.
assessmentProblems.answer: Displacement d = ⟨7-1, 4-2⟩ = ⟨6, 2⟩. W = F·d = (-3)(6)+5(2) = -18+10 = -8. (Negative work means the force partially opposes the motion.)

assessmentProblems.question: A 150-lb crate sits on a ramp inclined at 20° to the horizontal. Find: (a) the component of force parallel to the ramp, (b) the component perpendicular to the ramp, (c) the force needed to prevent the crate from sliding.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) F_∥ = 150 sin20° ≈ 150(0.3420) ≈ 51.30 lb. (b) F_⊥ = 150 cos20° ≈ 150(0.9397) ≈ 140.95 lb. (c) To prevent sliding, apply a force equal and opposite to F_∥ up the ramp: 51.30 lb.

assessmentProblems.question: Write z = 1 - √3 i in polar form. Then find z⁵ using DeMoivre's Theorem.
Find all cube roots of z = -27. Express answers in rectangular form.
